text: Hi guys, forgive me if this is the wrong channel, how do I stop HubSpot including Bootstrap on my templates? I've excluded any other stylesheets from the options:
for that you will need to make a coded template instead using the drag&drop
Ok, is the option not available to me to utilise the drag and drop editor with my own layout styles? I don't really want to use !important every time I want to differentiate from Bootstrap

well, most of the cases you can avoid `!important`s with the right CSS selectors.
So most of us we just overwrite that part of bootstrap when needed.
I would like to be able to remove it too tho.
I think that feature is on the road tho :slightly_smiling_face:
Cool :slightly_smiling_face: I'll just overwrite where needed for now, thanks

Looking for more people interested in Beta testing the Developer Chrome extension. <#CBBAW6Z3R|community-browser-extension> head to the channel if interested, link to install the beta version is there. Get new features before everyone else.
If I was doing more active development ... and if I was a good developer ... I'd be totally down. :upside_down_face:
LMK if you really need some more folks, I can do some checking around

My goal is to get to around 10% of the total amount of users of the extension to be using the beta version. I figure that’s a good group that’d make it easier to catch things. Last I checked we only had 20 something people using the beta version. Which is not a statistically great number in comparison to the over 1,000 installs we have.

Related: *do any of you currently use Microsoft Edge?* due to the chromium version of Edge coming out soon I will be actively investigating how easy it is to support Edge in the developer extension, and submitting to their extension “store” when available.
